retention_recommendations.reason: Lowest combined metrics with 2.4 evaluation score, 32 SGP, incomplete PD, 84% attendance, and provisional certification status.
Low performance metrics with 2.5 evaluation score, 35 SGP, incomplete PD, 88% attendance, and pending certification renewal.
Poor performance with 2.8 evaluation score, 38 SGP, incomplete PD, 85% attendance, and documented attendance policy violations.

reassignment_recommendations.rationale: Below average performance metrics (3.0 evaluation, 42 SGP) indicate teacher may not be well-suited for specialized STEM program requirements.
Low evaluation score (2.7) and student growth (40) suggest teacher needs more experience before specialized program assignment.

priority_hiring_needs.justification: Two math teachers (T401, T103) have below-average performance metrics, and one is recommended for non-renewal, creating staffing gap in core subject area.
Current English teachers show concerning performance (T118 recommended for non-renewal, T298 for reassignment), indicating need for strong replacements.
With T205 recommended for non-renewal, additional science teaching capacity is needed to maintain adequate staffing in this core subject area.

staffing_plan.rationale: Required to provide overall program leadership and coordination as specified in implementation guidelines.
Two full-time mathematics teachers needed to support 150 students in the STEM Academy as specified in requirements.
Two full-time science teachers required to deliver specialized science curriculum for 150 STEM Academy students.
One technology teacher needed to provide computer science and technology instruction for the program.
One engineering teacher required to deliver engineering curriculum component of the STEM program.
One instructional paraprofessional needed to support teachers and provide additional assistance to students.
Half-time guidance counselor required to provide academic and career counseling specific to STEM pathways.

budget_allocation.adjustments_needed: Personnel costs calculated using mid-range salaries for all positions to stay within 80% budget allocation for staffing while ensuring competitive compensation.

implementation_timeline.action_items: Finalize job descriptions and post all seven required positions through district HR system and external job boards.
Screen applications for minimum qualifications and create shortlist of candidates for first-round interviews.
Conduct initial interviews with qualified candidates for all positions using standardized interview protocols.
Complete all first-round interviews and identify candidates to advance to second round.
Begin in-depth interviews with finalists, including teaching demonstrations and panel interviews with stakeholders.
Complete all second-round interviews and prepare hiring recommendations for each position.
Make final selections for all positions and begin reference checks and background verification process.
Issue formal contracts to selected candidates and collect signed agreements to confirm staffing plan.
Conduct comprehensive orientation for all new STEM Academy staff on program goals and expectations.
Begin STEM Academy program with complete staffing in place and all preparations completed.

documentation_requirements.description: Attendance record showing dates and reasons for absences
Record of prior conversations or warnings about attendance
Evidence that district policies were followed in addressing the issue
Documentation of impact on educational services
Signatures of all parties involved in the conference
